in a public place under the influence of or in a state of intoxication as the result of inhaling any glue paint or cement containing one or more of the solvents named in section 121  81572 sound and vibration a legislative findings the city council of the city of south houston finds and declares 1 that sound and vibration of such character intensity and duration as are reasonably calculated to be detrimental to the health welfare or safety of a reasonably sensitive person degrades the environment of the city to a degree which a is harmful and hazardous to the health welfare and safety of its inhabitants  b interferes with the comfortable enjoyment of life property and recreation and with the conduct and operation of business and industry  and c is a nuisance in fact 2 the effective control and elimination of excessive sound and vibration is essential to the furtherance of the health welfare and safety of the citys inhabitants b definitions the following definitions shall apply to this section and the appropriate court shall take judicial notice of same 1 ambient sound pressure level composite of sound in the environment excluding the specific sound under investigation 2 aweighted network dba frequency response characteristics provided by a standard sound level meter which attempts to duplicate the response of the human ear to a measured sound pressure level 3 decibel db a measurement used to express the sound pressure level or intensity of sound it is defined as a dimensionless unit related to the logarithm of the ratio of a measured quantity to a reference quantity 4 equivalent continuous sound pressure level  l eq used to denote the average sound pressure level in dba during a specified period of time 5 octave band analysis a detailed measurement that divides sound into component or octave bands which are limited to a specific frequency range sound pressure levels are assigned to each octave band the specific frequency range is considered to be an octave in width when the upper band edge frequency is twice the lower band edge frequency 6 octave band analyzer an instrument that measures sound pressure levels within a specific frequency range denoted as an octave band 7 octave band center frequency a designation for the octave band frequency widths the octave band center frequency is the geometric mean of the upper and lower band edge frequencies 8 peak sound pressure level used to denote the maximum instantaneous sound pressure level during a specified period of time 9 person means a person firm association joint venture corporation or any entity public or private in nature 10 real property boundary an imaginary line along the ground surface and its vertical extension which separates the real property owned or in possession of one person from that real property owned or in possession of another 11 receiving real property any property outside the real property boundary of the sound source 12 reference quantity the reference quantity used is  newtons per meter squared nm 2   this quantity is further defined as zero db 13 residential property any location used for noncommercial purposes as a place of abode by any person 14 sound any pressure variation that can be detected by the human ear 15 sound amplifying equipment any machine or device for the amplification of the human voice music or other 16 sound level meter an instrument which includes a microphone amplifier rms detector integrator or time averager output meter and weighting networks to measure sound pressure levels and that meets the american national standards institute ansi specifications 17 vibration an oscillatory motion of solid bodies described by displacement velocity or acceleration c prohibited conduct 1 it shall be unlawful for any person to operate or cause to be operated any source of sound or vibration or to discharge or allow the escape of any sound or vibration a of such character intensity volume or duration as to be unreasonably loud raucous jarring disturbing or annoying to a reasonably sensitive person within the area or property receiving such sound or vibration  or b that causes adverse psychological or physiological effects detrimental to the health welfare or safety of a reasonably sensitive person within the area or property receiving such sound or vibration  or c which is in violation of standards prescribed by this section 2 it shall be prima facie unlawful and a violation of this section for any person to operate or cause to be operated any source of sound or to discharge or allow the escape of any sound in such a manner as to cause or create a sound pressure level which reaches or exceeds the following standards when measured at any point within the real property boundary of the receiving real property a a peak sound pressure level of seventyfive 75 dba at any time on any receiving property b a peak sound pressure level of ten 10 db above the ambient measured on any nonresidential property located between the hours of  pm and  am on any day of the week c a peak sound pressure level of five 5 db above the ambient measured on any residential property location between the hours of  pm and  am on any day of the week d a peak sound pressure level of ten 10 db above ambient as measured in any octave band center frequency as follows octave band center frequencies hertz 63 125 250 500 1000 2000 4000 8000 3 it shall be prima facie unlawful and a violation of this section for any person to operate or cause to be operated any source of vibration or to discharge or allow the escape of any vibration in such a manner as to cause by such operation a vibration that can be detected without the aid of instruments at any point within the receiving real property 4 it shall be unlawful and a violation of this article for any person to use operate or permit to be played used or operated any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph or other machine or device for the producing or reproducing of sound including but not limited to amplification equipment contained in or mounted on a motor vehicle in such a manner as to disturb the peace quiet and comfort of the neighboring inhabitants or at any time with louder volume than is necessary for convenient hearing for the persons who are in the room vehicle or chamber in which such machine or device is operated the operation of such set instrument phonograph machine device or amplification equipment in such a manner as to be plainly audible at a distance of fifty 50 feet from the building structure or vehicle in which it is located shall be prima facie evidence of a violation of this section d measurements and standards 1 measurement of sound may be made as applicable with a sound level meter or with an octave band analyzer meeting the standards prescribed by the american standards institute ansi a calibration check shall be made before and after the time of any sound measurement sound measurements shall be obtained in a manner that provides proper representation of the sound in question a microphone windscreen shall be used when necessary to avoid interference from the wind the instrument shall be positioned at arms length or positioned on a stationary tripod with the microphone positioned in such a manner that will avoid an unnatural enhancement or diminution of the sound in question traffic aircraft and other sound shall not be considered except in instances where they interfere with the sound of interest or ambient samples to establish a representative sound sample at least three 3 sound measurements should be taken within an hour period on at least two 2 separate occasions sound samples shall be obtained specifically during sound producing and nonproducing or ambient conditions ambient sound pressure level shall be obtained in the same manner as described above during periods of ambient conditions ambient sound pressure levels shall be obtained as soon as possible and at the same location used to obtain sound pressure levels of the sound of interest 2 the city or its designated agents or representatives may inspect from time to time any installation premises equipment devices and appurtenances thereto that may can or do cause sounds or vibrations and the city may take measurements and make analysis of such sound or vibration where directed the owner shall provide assistance in obtaining normal operating conditions during periods of measurement 3 the city may order the owner lessee or any agent of any source of sound andor vibration which may be or is in excess of that permitted by this section or the regulations adopted hereunder to furnish such information plans specifications analysis performance data and tests or examinations as will disclose the nature effects extent quantity watts or degree of sound or vibration which are or may be discharged from such source e penalties and remedies 1 any person who violates any provision of this section shall be guilty of an offense and upon conviction thereof shall be fined in an amount not to exceed one thousand dollars $100000 a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues and shall be punishable as such 2 the penalty provided for herein shall be in addition to any other legal remedies available to the city to prevent and prohibit any such violation of this section the city may institute any appropriate administrative action or proceeding or any action at law or equity to require compliance with the provisions of this section  51788   41895 cross reference prohibition against noise resulting from playing games on streets and public property  1919 discharge of did not specifically amend the this ordinance was treated as amending article v to read as herein set out formerly such article pertained to similar provisions and derived from  41994 authority findings purpose and intent a these regulations are promulgated pursuant to and in conformity with of the local government texas as amended the city council of south houston makes the following findings 1 that sexually oriented businesses require special supervision in order to protect and preserve the health safety and welfare of the patrons of such businesses as well as the citizens of the communities where they locate  2 that permitting sexually oriented businesses is a legitimate means of accountability to help ensure that operators of sexually oriented businesses comply with reasonable regulations and to help ensure that enterprise operators do not knowingly or carelessly allow their establishments to be used as places of illegal sexual activity or solicitation  3 that sexually oriented businesses due to their nature have objectionable operational characteristics especially when they are located in proximity to each other such proximity contributes to urban blight and downgrades the quality of life in adjacent areas  4 that sexually oriented businesses can exert dehumanizing influences on churches schools and daycare centers  have negative effects on property values  can contribute to increased criminal activities in surrounding areas and exert the same types of negative community influences on other forms of land uses  5 that a distance of one thousand five hundred 1500 feet for sexually oriented businesses from various types of establishments will help provide additional protection to the community from the adverse effects of sexually oriented businesses without depriving such businesses of adequate opportunities to locate within incorporated areas of the city of south houston texas  and 6 that the city council of south houston wants to help prevent adverse effects caused by sexually oriented businesses the council also desires to help protect the health safety and welfare of its citizenry  help protect the public from increased crime  help preserve the quality of life  help preserve property values and the character of surrounding neighborhoods and help deter the spread of urban blight b it is the intent of the city of south houston to exercise its regulatory powers permitted under of the local government to enact a content neutral order that addresses the secondary effects of sexually oriented businesses the city of south houston desires to establish reasonable and uniform regulations of sexually oriented businesses to promote and protect the health safety and general welfare of the citizens of the city of south houston the city council of south houston also desires to prohibit activities that merely serve as a front for activities prohibited by the texas penal including but not limited to prostitution and the promotion of prostitution c these regulations have neither the purpose nor effect of imposing a limitation or restriction of the content of any communicative material including sexually oriented material similarly it is not the intent nor effect of these regulations to restrict or deny access by adults to sexually oriented material protected by the first amendment of the united states to deny access by the distributors and exhibitors of sexually oriented entertainment to their intended market or to suppress any speech activities protected by the first amendment the promotion of obscene material not protected by the first amendment can be prosecuted criminal sanctions under the penal code d these regulations do not legalize anything prohibited under the texas penal any other law or these conditions shall address the public health and safety concerns identified in the hearing g an sobp shall be valid for one year from the date it is issued unless the sobp is revoked or suspended determination the written notice does not prohibit the city of south houston texas in litigation on appeal from presenting evidence of additional or alternative facts that support denial of the sobp xiv 32602 revocation or suspension a the executive director shall have the authority and power to initiate a proceeding to revoke or suspend an sobp if there is probable cause to believe that one or more of the following events or conditions has occurred 1 the enterprise operator negligently allowed a person under eighteen 18 years of age to remain on the premises of the sobe during the hours of operation  2 the enterprise failed to comply with a duty specifically imposed by these regulations  3 the applicant provided materially false fraudulent or untruthful information on the original or renewal sobp application form  4 the sobp should not have been issued pursuant to these regulations  or 5 the enterprise operator commits or is convicted of a criminal offense listed in subsections 1280e4aj of these regulations b if probable cause is found to believe any of the stated events or conditions occurred the executive director shall forward to the sobp holder or its designated agent a written notice of revocation the notice shall set out the reasons for the action subject to a request for hearing pursuant to this section the revocation shall become final on the eleventh 11 th  business day after notice is provided pursuant to these regulations c the sobe or its designated agent shall have the opportunity to appear before a hearing examiner appointed by the mayor upon written request submitted to the executive director within ten 10 business days of delivery of the notice of revocation the hearing examiner shall not have participated in any investigation of the alleged grounds for the revocation the hearing will be held as soon as is reasonably possible but preferably within fourteen 14 business days of the request for hearing the sobe and the executive director will be provided an opportunity to present evidence and crossexamine witnesses they also may be represented by legal counsel the rules of civil evidence for a nonjury trial shall apply d upon finding that the facts presented at the hearing support a finding that grounds exist for revoking or suspending the sobp the hearing examiner may request that the parties present relevant evidence to show whether suspension or revocation of the sobp is more appropriate the hearing examiner may also request that evidence be presented for the purpose of identifying appropriate conditions to be attached to an sobp if the sobp is suspended reasonable conditions may be attached to an sobp by the hearing examiner based on the evidence presented at the hearing e if the hearing examiner determines that an sobp should be revoked the hearing examiner shall issue a written order revoking the sobp when notice is provided to the enterprise operator pursuant to these regulations f if the hearing examiner determines based upon the nature of the violations that a suspension in lieu of revocation is appropriate operation of the sobp may be suspended for a period of time not to exceed two 2 weeks the hearing examiner shall issue a written order suspending the sobp and attaching conditions if applicable upon notice to the enterprise operator pursuant to these regulations g revocation shall be subject to the hearing provisions of this section but revocation shall take immediate effect upon notice being sent subject to reinstatement resulting from appeal when there is a necessity for immediate action to protect the public from injury or imminent danger h a revocation shall be in effect for a minimum of three 3 months after three 3 months another application could be made for an sobp the circumstances surrounding the revocation may be considered by the executive director xv 32602 notice a any notice required to be given by the executive director under these regulations to any applicant or enterprise operator may be given by personal delivery or by united states mail postage prepaid addressed to the most recent address as specified in the application for the sobp or the most recent notice of address change b mailed notice shall be deemed served five 5 days after deposit in the united states mail personal notice shall be deemed served when delivered to an enterprise operator or if the enterprise operator is not available posted at the entrance to the sobe if the notice is served or posted the individual serving or posting the notice will note the time and date of hisher action on a copy of the notice posted and return the copy to the executive director c if a notice given by mail is returned by the postal service as undeliverable it will be presumed the enterprise operator did not comply with the affirmative duty to notify the executive director of any change of address this presumption may be rebutted by the enterprise owners showing there was an error on the part of the post office xvi 32602 temporary sobp provisions if the executive director fails to take action on an application within the times specified or if the hearing officer fails to the executive director a temporary sobp shall be valid only until notice of the executive directors action on the application or the hearing examiners order this section shall not apply if the delay is wholly or partially caused by the action or inaction of the applicant xvii 32602 sobp renewals a sobp renewal applications must be filed not more than thirty 30 days prior to the expiration date of depicting specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas has the duty to comply with the following requirements 1 the sobe has the duty to maintain at least one employee on duty and situated in each managers station at all times that any patron is present inside the premises  2 the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view operators or managers stations designated the interior of the premises must be configured so that there is an unobstructed direct line of sight view from at least one station to all portions of the premises where patrons are allowed access excluding restrooms xxv 32602 persons younger than eighteen prohibited from entry a it shall be a violation of these regulations to allow a person who is enterprise at all times during the sobes business hours the attendant shall not allow any person under the age of eighteen 18 years of age to enter the sobe it shall be presumed that an attendant knew a person was under the age of eighteen 18 unless the attendant asked for and was furnished 1 a facially valid operators commercial operators or chauffeurs drivers license  or 2 a facially valid and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section unless the context of their usage clearly indicates a different meaning owner or occupant means the record owner of the lot or parcel of land or other person specifically authorized in writing by the record owner to authorize the placement of any painting scratching writing or inscription upon the owners property or the tenant of a residential or commercial property unauthorized means without the consent of the owner or occupant or without authority of law regulation or ordinance unless the owner proves otherwise lack of consent will be presumed under circumstances tending to show i the absence of evidence of specific authorization of the visual blight by the owner ii that the visual blight is inconsistent with the design and use of the subject property or iii that the person causing the visual blight was unknown to the owner visual blight means any unauthorized graffiti or any other unauthorized form of painting scratching writing or inscription including without limitation initials slogans or drawings regardless of the content or nature of the material that has been applied to any wall building fence sign or other structure or surface and is visible from any public property or rightofway or is visible from the private property of another person  51397 declaration  notice visual blight is declared to be a public nuisance whenever the existence of visual blight on any lot or parcel of real estate situated within the city shall come to the knowledge of the building official or his representative such official may forthwith cause a written notice identifying the visual blight and directing its removal to be delivered to the owner of the property provided that the time allowed in the notice for abatement of the nuisance shall not be less than ten 10 days and such a notice shall further state that the owner is entitled to request a hearing to be held in the manner described herein  51397 hearing the owner or occupant of a lot or parcel subject to abatement under this article may request a hearing by notifying the building inspector within ten 10 days following the date the city delivers the required notice the hearing shall be conducted by the building inspector for the purpose of determining whether the conditions constitute a public nuisance under the provisions of this article unless notice is waived by the owner the owner shall be provided written notice of the time and place of the hearing at least ten 10 days prior thereto at the hearing the owner or occupant and city officials may present any evidence relevant to the proceedings in accordance with reasonable rules adopted by the city council if the building inspector finds that conditions constituting a nuisance hereunder exist the building inspector shall issue an order so stating  51397 abatement by the city  expenses and liens a the city shall be authorized to carry representative b if the owner or occupant fails to abate the visual blight request or consent to its removal by the city or request a hearing or if it is determined at a hearing that the condition of the property constitutes a nuisance under this article then the city shall be authorized to carry out the abatement of the visual blight and to assess its expenses and place a lien on the property c if a lien is to be filed the building official of the city shall file a statement of expenses incurred under this article giving the amount of such expenses and the date on which the work was done or improvements made with the county clerk and the city shall have a privileged lien on such lot or real estate upon which the work was done or improvements made to secure the expenditures so made in accordance with the provisions of the law the amount of such expenses shall bear six 6 percent interest per annum as allowed by law from the date such statement is filed for any such expenditures and interest suit may be instituted and recovery and foreclosure of such lien may be had in the name of the city and the statement of expenses so made or a certified copy thereof shall be prima facie proof of the amount expended for such work or improvement the building official is authorized to accept payments for such liens in installments and give releases or partial releases as necessary d if the abatement involves painting the blighted surface the city will paint over the visual blight area but paint may not match exactly e the city council authorizes the use of funds and provision of and intent that repeat sexual offenders sexual offenders who use physical violence and sexual offenders who prey on children are sexual predators who present an extreme threat to the public safety sexual offenders are extremely likely to use physical violence and to repeat their offenses and most sexual offenders commit many offenses have many more victims than are ever reported and are prosecuted for only a fraction of their crimes this makes the cost of sexual offender victimization to society at large while incalculable clearly exorbitant it is the intent of this article to serve the citys compelling interest to promote protect and improve the health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city by creating areas around locations where children regularly congregate in concentrated numbers wherein certain sexual offenders and sexual predators are prohibited from establishing temporary or permanent residences  71106 definitions the following words terms and phrases side or end of any other mobile home parked thereon  mobile home foundations or supports each unit shall be so constructed as to provide a reinforced fourinch concrete pad with minimum dimensions of twenty 20 feet by fifty 50 feet  water lines and sewer connections each unit in a mobile home park shall be provided with water lines and sanitary sewer connections subject to all applicable ordinances rules and regulations of the city and in accordance with the mobile home park standards referred to in section 1365  offstreet parking parking shall be provided at the rate of not less than two 2 parking spaces per mobile home space located on the individual lot or within a common offstreet parking lot  utility easements easements shall be provided for installation of utilities exclusive of water and sewer which shall be the sole responsibility of the owner additional requirements for public utility easements shall be determined by the building inspector  mobile home anchorage every mobile home shall be blocked and anchored in accordance with specifications set by the state of texas  drainage easements where a mobile home park is traversed by a water course drainage way channel or stream there shall be provided a storm water easement or drainage rightofway conforming substantially with the lines of such water course and of sufficient width as determined by the building inspector  mobile home patio or porch each unit within the mobile home park shall have constructed a four 4 inch thick concrete slab with minimum fifty 50 square feet area reinforced with six 6 inches by six 6 inches wire mesh to be used as the floor of either a covered or uncovered porch or patio  sewage system installation sanitary sewers sanitary sewers shall be installed to serve each lot in all mobile home parks where connection is to be made immediately to a community disposal system or to a public sewage system as may be specified by the city of south houston  water system installation all water supply treatment storage and distribution facilities shall be furnished and installed in compliance with the requirements of the standard specifications of the city of south houston the current policies and specifications of the building inspector and the texas state department of health  sanitary sewer specifications a all gravity sewers shall be vitrified clay epoxy lined asbestos cement sewer pipe or schedule 40 polyvinyl chloride pvc drainwastevent pipe or better conforming to astm and the national sanitation foundation standard 14 and commercial standard cs 27265 and cs 20760 b the minimum size of lateral sewer mains within the mobile home park area shall be six 6 inches in diameter minimum grades shall be sufficient to produce a velocity of 16 feet  per second c all outfall mains shall be of sufficient size to accommodate the maximum anticipated flow from the entire area tributary to the line as approved by the building inspector d lift stations shall be furnished where necessary of such size and design as approved by the building inspector  water main specifications a all water distribution mains shall be cast iron asbestos cement pipe or polyvinyl chloride pvc type 112 schedule 40 or better and installed in conformance to astm standard d178460t with the specifications of the city public works department other suitable material may be used when authorized by the building inspector b the minimum size of lateral water mains shall be six 6 inches in diameter except that a small main may be used when a looped system designed to serve less than eighteen 18 families is approved by the building inspector c all principal mains shall be of sufficient size to meet all anticipated requirements of the system as approved by the building inspector to grow within six 6 feet of any equipment or installation 5 an automatic shutoff valve shall be installed in the equipment of each such gas well which will shut off the flow of gas in the event that good order upon the premises where any transient amusement is operated b standards for maintenance of premises 1 access the licensee shall provide access available to public streets or other public ways at all times to facilitate departure of persons from the premises where the transient amusement is operated and to permit entrance of fire apparatus or other emergency equipment in case of emergency 2 lighting licensee shall provide suitable and necessary artificial light whenever natural light is inadequate 3 electrical installations the electrical system shall be installed maintained and operated in a safe and workmanlike manner all electrical equipment must meet the requirements of the electrical code of the city cables on the ground in areas traversed by the public shall be protected by approved covers the electrical installations shall be inspected and approved by the city electrical inspector before the transient amusement is opened to the public and shall thereafter be open to inspection by the electrical inspector at all reasonable hours 4 fire extinguishing equipment fire extinguishing equipment shall be furnished by the licensee in such type and quantity and in such locations as may be directed by the city fire marshal fire extinguishing equipment shall be inspected and approved by the city fire marshal before the transient amusement is open to the public and shall thereafter be open to inspection by the city fire marshal at all reasonable hours 5 sanitary facilities when sanitary facilities are to be made available to the public they shall be inspected and approved by the department of health 6 attendants at all times when a transient amusement is open to the public the licensee shall provide an adequate number of attendants and special police who shall be responsible for seeing that order is maintained that disorderly or immoral conduct is prevented that the entrances and exits are kept free from congestion and that this article and all other governing ordinances rules and regulations pertaining to transient amusements are observed 7 noise the transient amusement shall be operated in such manner as to comply with of the ordinances of the city of south houston 8 concessions any sales of items covered by any health ordinance of the city of south houston shall be strictly in compliance with such ordinance and licensee shall obtain the required permits and health certificates prior to the making of such sales to the public 9 inspection officers of the police department are hereby authorized and empowered to enter upon the premises where any transient amusement is being operated within the city at any time for the purpose of inspection for preservation of law and order and to determine compliance with the provisions of this article c standard for vacated premises 1 licensee shall upon removal of a transient amusement licensed hereunder clean the premises of any trash rubbish and other unsightly or unsanitary matter which has accumulated thereon within twentyfour 24 hours after removal of the transient amusement 2 licensee shall to guarantee compliance with the foregoing subsection 1 prior to the time a license is issued for the operation of a transient amusement post with the building official a bond in the minimum amount of five hundred dollars $50000 which shall be issued by a company doing business in the state of texas  101888 suspension of license  appeal the health officer building official chief of police fire marshal or fire chief shall upon discovery of a transient amusement being operated in violation of the terms of this article immediately suspend the license to operate such transient amusement until such violations are removed suspension shall be by notice to the licensee or to the person in charge of the operation of such transient amusement the official who acts to suspend a license under the terms of this section shall within twentyfour 24 hours following such action file a written report with the building official setting forth the exact violation the date and hour of suspension and whether the violation has been removed by the licensee where a coinoperated machines division 1  generally definitions for the purposes of this article the following definitions shall apply coinoperated machine the term coinoperated machine means every machine or hereinafter defined including but not limited to coinoperated video games shall be included in the term coinoperated machine music coinoperated machine the term music coinoperated machine shall mean and include every coinoperated machine of any kind or character which dispenses or vends or which is used or operated for dispensing or vending music and which is operated by or with coins metal slugs tokens checks or similar objects the following are expressly included within such term coinoperated phonographs pianos gramophones radios and all other coinoperated machines which dispense or vend music operator the term operator shall mean and include any person firm company association or corporation who exhibits displays or permits to be exhibited or displayed in his or its place of business coinoperated machine in this city owner is solely responsible for paying to the city the occupation tax on each coinoperated machine exhibited or displayed within the city and for securing the city decal evidencing payment of such tax on each coinoperated machine service coinoperated machine the term service coinoperated machine means pay toilets pay telephones and all other machines or devices which dispense service only and not merchandise music skill or pleasure skill or pleasure coinoperated machine the term skill or pleasure coinoperated machine means every coinoperated machine or device of any kind or character that is used or capable of use for pleasure or requires or is capable of rewarding or recognizing some degree of user skill in its use or operation or for any purpose other than dispersing or vending of merchandise music or service exclusively as those terms are defined herein the following are expressly included within such term electronic video games marble machines or marble table machines pin ball machines marble shooting machines pachinko machines miniature golf machines miniature bowling machines coinoperated billiard or pool tables and all or any other coinoperated machines which satisfy some sense of skill or pleasure including but not limited to every coinoperated machine or device that dispenses or vends merchandise prizes trinkets novelties commodities or confections or that plays music with or in addition to such games or devices  22189   101789   82410 tax imposed  amount  registration a every owner save an owner holding an application including the written application together with the action of the city of south houston and the reasons for such action the city council shall within thirty 30 days grant a hearing thereon to determine the correctness of the action of the city of south houston at which hearing the council may make such investigation as it may deem fit whether all the pertinent facts appear in the application or not within seven 7 days after final adjournment of the hearing the city council shall cause a written deduction of its judgment thereon to be filed with the city secretary  22189 the warrant  90694 unearned fees warrant fees shall be considered unearned by the warrant holder and shall be retained in the municipal general fund under the following circumstances 1 if a person named in a warrant is arrested by another agency the warrant fee shall not be considered earned by the warrant holder regardless of whether a the arresting agency collects the bond or fine and forwards it to south houston police department  b another person comes to south houston police department and pays the bond or fine to gain the release of the person arrested  or c the person arrested is transferred to the custody of south houston police department 2 if a person named in a south houston police department warrant is arrested by an onduty commissioned member of this agency including the warrant holder the warrant fee shall not be considered earned by the warrant holder unless the warrant holder can provide empirical evidence via activity documentation combined with the supporting warrant execution by arrest a participants are encouraged to use alternative means to execute their issued warrants prior to incarcerating warrant suspects when practical however when affecting such arrest 1 they will be executed only by a uniformed commission member of south houston police department 2 the commissioned member thus executing a warrant must be in a marked south houston police department vehicle the use of this vehicle must be approved by the chief of police or hisher designee  all commissioned members using this vehicle must be in uniform 3 when executed inside the corporate limits of south houston by one 1 south houston police department commissioned member 4 when executed outside the corporate limits of south houston by one 1 south houston department commissioned member heshe shall before entering another city call and request a backup from the law enforcement agency having primary jurisdiction at that location 5 when executed outside the a history of any assaultive offense 7 noncommissioned members shall not participate in the physical arrest of persons named in any municipal warrants 8 noncommissioned members are expressly prohibited be for the positive identification of a warranted subject only  90694 work locations a all participants are authorized to perform their warrant service activities ie telephoning mailout preparation participants or their designated proxy must pick up their warrants within one hundred twenty 120 hours five 5 days of the official posting that warrants are ready for issuance 3 upon the official the execution of warrants assigned to them  however warrant fees will only be paid to the assigned warrant holder the payment of any monetary amounts due other participants as a result of such agreements shall be the responsibility of the warrant holder and any conflicts arising therefrom will not be resolved by the administration b any officer wishing to participate in the warrant fee system will be required to be on an active call out list this list will be on a weekly basis the call out list will be used when other agencies call and have a subject in custody they need to have picked up the shift supervisor will be responsible for making the decision as to whether an officer should be called or if the working shift can handle it any officer called out will receive call out time any officer that does not wish to be on the call out list will not be eligible to participate in the warrant program only in sickness or emergency will an officer be dismissed from call out it will be permissible for officers to trade weeks as long as it is confirmed in writing and agreeable with both officers  90694 severability the governing body of the city of south houston texas does event it would have passed and ordained any and all remaining portions of this article without the inclusion of that portion or portions which may be so found to be unconstitutional or invalid and apply to all signs as that term is defined herein within the extraterritorial jurisdiction or the corporate limits of the city of south houston texas exh a 61411 purpose and intent it is the intent and purpose of this chapter to establish the reasonable orderly and effective display of outdoor advertising existing and proposed in the corporate limits of the city of south houston exh a 61411   superiority clause if any subdivision or individual tract of land contains restrictions or covenants relating to signs or any person or persons enter into a legally binding agreement which provides for the regulating of signs in a particular development which are more restrictive than these regulations the more restrictive requirements shall apply exh a 61411 definitions the following definitions shall apply to this chapter advertising shall mean to seek the attraction of or to direct the attention of the public to any goods services or merchandise whatsoever or a location that provides goods services or merchandise alterations or repair to an advertising display means repairs or improvements to a display sign or sign structure banner shall mean any piece of cloth plastic canvas or similar material on which there appears a display typically supported at both ends building inspector or code enforcement officer shall mean the building inspector or code enforcement officer as defined herein and those representatives that he may designate business shall mean the erection or use of any property building or structure permanent or temporary for the primary purpose of conducting in said building or structure or on said property a legitimate commercial enterprise compliant with all ordinances and regulations of the city of south houston governing such activity  business purpose shall not include any property building or structure erected or used for the primary purpose of securing a permit or erecting a sign city shall mean the city of south houston texas display shall mean the message of any sign whether it be in words symbols or objects face shall mean the total display area and border of a sign federal primary system shall mean the interstate and freeway primary system and the nonfreeway primary system intersection shall mean the intersection of streets driveways alleys or any two surfaces intended for motor vehicles interstate and freeway primary system shall mean the portion of the national system of interstate and defense highways located within texas which are now or hereafter may be officially designated the interstate system by the texas department of public transportation commission and approved pursuant to title 3 united states as amended nameplate shall mean a nonelectrical sign identifying only the name and occupation or profession of the occupants of premises on which the sign is located and not exceeding six 6 inches by eighteen 18 inches nonfreeway primary system shall mean that portion of the connective main highway located within texas which now or hereafter may be designated the primary system by the texas highway and public transportation commission and approved pursuant to title 23 united states as amended owner shall mean the person who owns or leases the onpremises sign person shall mean an individual company corporation partnership association or any other entity primarily residential area shall mean the rightofway and adjoining property area between two 2 intersecting public streets in which a majority of the total front footage is used for residential purposes public street shall mean the entire width between property lines of any road street way alley bridge or other similar thoroughfare not privately owned or controlled when any part thereof is open to the public for vehicular traffic is the responsibility of the city or other public agency to maintain and over which the city has legislative jurisdiction under its police power reconstruction shall mean the repair of a sign registration shall mean the registration of the currently existing signs relocate shall mean the removal of a sign and any supporting structure from one location and placing it or its replacement at a new location residential purposes shall mean property devoted to use as a single family or multifamily residence residential purposes shall include but not be limited to property used for houses duplexes condominiums town homes patio homes and apartments  property used for hotels motels and boarding houses shall not be considered as used for residential purposes property devoted to both residential and nonresidential use shall be considered as used for residential purposes rightofway shall mean the property fronting or immediately adjacent to and on either side of a public street or a nonpublic street which the public authority has the authority to use for the road or street sight triangle shall mean the triangle formed at an intersection by intersecting curb lines and a noncurb line joining the curb lines the triangle is shown in section 2273 of the ordinances of the city of south houston sign shall mean any structure or part thereof device inscription symbol or object which is located upon attached to or painted or represented on any land or on the outside of any building or structure or on an awning canopy marquee or similar appendage or permanently affixed to the glass of a window or door so as to be seen from the outside of the building or structure and which displays or includes any numeral letter word model banner emblem insignia symbol device monogram heraldry trademark light or other representation used as or in the nature of an announcement advertisement attentionarrester direction warning or designation of any person firm group organization corporation association place commodity product service business profession enterprise industry activity or any combination thereof where the word sign is used herein without further modification the same shall be understood to embrace all regulated signs sign appeals committee shall mean the committee as defined herein and appointed as established herein sign company shall mean the person who engages in the business of leasing constructing or maintaining signs or sign structures sign structure shall mean any structure which supports or is capable of supporting any sign a sign structure may be a single pole and may or may not be an integral part of a building time periods shall mean calendar days unless otherwise specified such periods shall start on the day following the event starting the time period to run and end at  pm local time on the last day of such period any period ending on a day the city hall is closed for any reason shall be extended until the next actual working day at the city hall of the city of south houston visible shall mean that the message copy area or advertising display seen whether or not it is legible without visual aid by a person of normal visual acuity or simply stated it can be seen exh a 61411   101414 sign classifications a site classification for the purpose of this chapter signs shall be first classified as either an onpremises sign or an offpremises sign 1 onpremises sign shall mean any sign identifying or advertising the business person activity goods products or services primarily sold or offered for sale on the premises where the sign is installed and maintained when such premises are used for business purposes or which convey information or messages 2 offpremises signs should not be allowed b type classification all signs shall further be classified into one of the following type signs 1 ground sign shall mean a sign which is supported by uprights or braces in or upon the ground 2 marquee sign shall mean a projecting sign attached to or hung from a canopy or covered structure projecting from and supported by a frame or pipe support extending beyond a building 3 monument sign shall mean any sign six 6 feet or less from the natural ground level to the top of the sign such sign shall be solid from the ground to the top and permanently affixed to the ground at intersections 4 projecting sign shall mean any sign which is affixed to any building wall or structure and extends beyond the building wall or structure more than twelve 12 inches 5 roof sign shall mean any sign erected constructed or maintained above or upon the roof of any building 6 wall sign shall mean any sign affixed to or painted upon the wall of any building 7 flag sign shall mean any sign constructed of cloth canvas light fabric or material affixed to a building wall fence or on a staff or pole set in a concrete foundation 8 awning sign shall mean any sign made of cloth metal or plastic with a metal frame attached to a building and projecting over a sidewalk thoroughfare or parking area when the same is so erected as to permit its being raised to a position flat against the building when not in use  should not extend off of private property 9 canopy sign shall mean any sign other than an awning attached to a building projecting over a thoroughfare sidewalk or parking area and not erected so as to permit its being raised to a flat position against the building does not permit use of marquee letters and is commonly supported by poles or uprights set upon the underlying ground  should not extend off of private property 10 multiple business sign shall mean that type of sign that is a single structure but has a different display for each different business such as may be found at a shopping center c special function classification any onpremises or offpremises sign of any type may also be included within one or more of the following additional classifications according to the special functions of that sign 1 electrical sign shall mean any sign containing electrical wiring or utilizing electric current but not including signs illuminated by a light source exterior to the sign structure 2 portable sign shall mean any sign designed or constructed to be easily moved from one location to another including signs mounted upon a motor vehicle or designed to be mounted upon a trailer bench wheeled carrier or other nonmotorized mobile structure a portable sign with the wheels removed shall still be considered a portable sign hereunder for the purpose of this chapter trailer signs and signs on benches are portable signs 3 spectacular sign shall mean any sign which has any automatically changing advertising which is equipped with glaring or rotating strobe or spotlights or which has any moving message whatsoever 4 temporary sign shall mean any sign including a banner constructed of cardboard wallboard or other light materials not to exceed twelve 12 square feet in size further a temporary sign is intended to be used for a specific period of time not to exceed thirty 30 days and then removed a portable sign and flag sign shall not be considered a temporary sign 5 moveable sign shall mean signs designed to be moved by hand and normally stored inside the building during the nighttime not allowed exh a 61411   101414 sign administration and enforcement a building inspector or code enforcement officer the mayor shall appoint or shall designate a building inspector or code enforcement officer to administer and enforce the terms and conditions of this chapter and all other provisions of the laws relating to signs the building inspector or code enforcement officer is empowered to delegate the duties and powers granted to and imposed upon himher by this chapter to other persons serving under the building inspector or code enforcement officer the building inspector or code enforcement officer and such other persons shall constitute the sign administration section the building inspector or code enforcement officer is directed to enforce and carry out all provisions of this chapter b enforcement responsibility the duties of the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall include not only the approval of issuance of permits as required by this chapter but also the responsibility of ensuring that all signs comply with this chapter and all other applicable law and that all signs for which a permit is required do in fact have a permit the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall make such inspections as may be necessary and initiate appropriate actions to bring about compliance with this chapter and other applicable laws if such inspection discloses any instance of noncompliance the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall investigate thoroughly any complaints of alleged violations of this chapter c powers of the building inspector or code enforcement officer the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall have the power and authority to administer and enforce the conditions of this chapter and all other laws relating to signs included among such powers are the following specific powers 1 inspection and approval every sign for which a permit is required shall be subject to the inspection and approval of the building inspector or code enforcement officer when deemed advisable by the building inspector or code enforcement officer a sign may be inspected at the point of manufacture if such point is within or adjacent to the city limits of the city of south houston 2 warrantless search presentation of proper identification to the owner agent or tenant in charge of such property will admit the building inspector or code enforcement officer or his representative to the premises to inspect said premises concerning the sign the applicant owner or other person in charge of the premises where the sign is located agrees by making application for a sign or renewal for a sign permit to admit the building inspector or code enforcement officer or representative for the purposes of inspecting and investigating signs or sign structure any building structure or other premises or property between the hours of  am and  pm monday 30 am and  am on friday  provided however that in cases of emergency where extreme hazards are known to exist which may involve imminent injury to persons loss of life or severe property damage and where the owner agent or tenant in charge of the property is not available after the building inspector or code enforcement officer has made a good faith effort to locate same the building inspector or code enforcement officer may enter the aforementioned structures and premises at any time upon presentation of proper identification to any other person on the premises 3 stop order when the building inspector or code enforcement officer or hisher representative discovers that a sign is being constructed not in conformance with this chapter heshe shall issue a stop work order to the person or persons known to be so engaged upon notice and issuance of a stop order from the building inspector or code enforcement officer work on any sign being conducted in a manner contrary to the provisions of this chapter or being conducted in a dangerous or unsafe manner shall be immediately stopped such notice and order shall be in writing and shall be given to the owner of the property or to his agent or to the person doing the work and shall state the conditions under which work may be resumed where an emergency exists written notice shall not be required to be given by the building inspector or code enforcement officer the stop order shall contain a notice of the right to appeal as provided herein work shall not resume until the condition causing the stoppage is corrected to the building inspector or code enforcement officers satisfaction or the appeal process results in a reversal of the administrators stop order 4 permit and license revocation the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall have and is hereby granted the power and the authority to revoke any and all licenses or permits authorized by this mail with return receipt requested to the address given by the permittee or licensee on the application for such permit or license to advise the permittee or licensee of such revocation and notify the minimum of six 6 feet from said sign on all sides and entirely to the street curb on the side nearest the street and debris etc will be removed at least weekly 2 all signs shall be thoroughly painted as often as is necessary  unless constructed of galvanized or noncorroding metal or treated with appropriate wood preservative and shall be kept in good repair consistent with good maintenance all braces bolts clips supporting frame and fastenings shall be free from deterioration termite infestation rot or loosening all signs shall be able to withstand safely at all times the wind pressures specified elsewhere in this chapter in case any sign is not so maintained the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall give written notice to the owner or lessee thereof to so maintain the signs or to remove the sign nonmaintenance shall be considered a misdemeanor and penalty shall be assessed accordingly b unsafe signs should any sign in the opinion of the building inspector or code enforcement officer become unsecure or in danger of falling or otherwise unsafe the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall give written notice of the condition of the sign to the person owning the sign said person so notified shall correct the unsafe condition of the sign in a manner to be approved by the building inspector or code enforcement officer in conformity with the provisions of this chapter c unlawful signs in case any sign shall be installed erected constructed or maintained in violation of any of the terms of this chapter in addition to any other rights and remedies provided herein the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall give written notice to the owner lessee or person responsible for said sign ordering said owner lessee or person to alter the sign such that it complies with this chapter or to remove the sign d removal of signs 1 signs with current permits any sign with a current operating permit that is in violation of the previsions herein shall be subject to removal the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall notify the person responsible for the sign by certified mail return receipt requested to repair or remove within twenty 20 days if the sign is not repaired or removed the city may remove the sign at the owners expense and a lien may be placed against the property of the owner for such expense 2 signs without current permits any sign without a current operating permit that is in violation of the provisions herein shall be subject to removal the building inspector or code enforcement officer shall notify the person responsible for the sign by certified mail return receipt requested to remove the sign within ten 10 days if the sign is not removed the city may remove the sign at the owners expense and a lien may be placed against the property of the owner for such expense 3 abandoned signs any abandoned sign or sign structure shall be treated as a sign without a current permit 4 removal 101414 structural requirements  generally and for specific signs a design 1 general all sites and sign structures shall be designed and constructed to resist wind forces as specified in this section all bracing systems shall be designed and constructed to transfer lateral forces to the foundations for signs on buildings the dead and lateral loads shall be transmitted structural frame of the building to the ground in such manner as not to overstress any of the elements thereof the overturning moment produced from lateral forces shall in no case exceed twothirds  23  of the deal load resisting moment for all signs uplift due to overturning shall be adequately resisted by proper anchorage to the ground or to the structural frame of the building for all signs the weight of earth superimposed over footings may be used in determining the deadload resisting moment such earth shall be carefully placed and thoroughly compacted 2 wind loads all signs and sign structures shall be designed to resist wind loads as follows wind load pressures in pounds per square foot for all signs height above ground feet pressure poundssq feet  050 30 measured above the average level of the ground adjacent to the structure 3 vertical design loads vertical design loads except roof live loads shall be assumed to be acting simultaneously with the wind loads 4 working stress all signs shall be designed to conform with the requirements of the 2006 edition of the international building regarding allowable working stresses the working strength of chains cables guys or steel rods shall not exceed onefifth  15  of the ultimate strength of such chains cables guys or steel rods 5 registered engineers seal all commercially erected signs shall be approved by a professional registered engineer registered in the state of texas and all plans shall contain the engineers seal b construction 1 general the supports for all signs or sign structures shall be placed in or upon private property and shall be securely built constructed and erected in conformance with the requirements of the 2006 edition of the international building 2 materials materials for construction of all signs and sign structures shall be of the quality and grade as specified for building in the 2006 edition of the international building 3 nonstructural trim nonstructural trim and portable display surface may be of wood metal approved plastics or any combination thereof consistent with the 2006 edition of the international building 4 anchorage members supporting unbraced signs shall be so proportioned that the bearing loads imposed on the soil in either direction horizontal or vertical shall not exceed the safe values stated in section 1814a1 herein all ground signs shall be anchored to resist the wind load specified in section 1815a2 herein acting in any direction anchors and supports shall be designed for safe bearing loads on the soil and for an effective resistance to pull out amounting to a force twentyfive 25 percent greater than the required resistance to overturning c electrical requirements all electrical fixtures equipment and appurtenances installed in conjunction with a sign shall be designed and installed in accordance with the city of south houstons electrical it now exists or may hereinafter be amended d clearances 1 clearances from high voltage power lines signs shall be located a minimum distance of twelve 12 feet measured horizontally and twelve 12 feet measured vertically from overhead electrical conductors commonly called distribution lines and a minimum distance of five 5 feet measured horizontally and five 5 feet measured vertically from what are commonly called service drop lines the term electrical conductors as used in this subsection means any electrical conductor either bare or insulated installed above the ground 2 clearance from poles no sign shall be erected nearer than five 5 feet horizontally or eight 8 feet vertically from any telephone pole or cable pole or crossmember of that pole e exempt signs not exempt from this section no sign which is otherwise exempt is exempt from the provisions of this section exh a 61411 paving of public alley a finding that alleys shall not be paved without preapproval including an acceptable drainage and paving plan the city council finds that the unpaved public alleys of the city shall not be paved or permitted to be paved by abutting lot owners or any other persons firms or corporations unless the paving is conducted entirely pursuant to a permit granted by the city after an acceptable drainage and paving plan for the paved area and its surroundings has been filed with and approved by the city and then only if the paving is done in a good and workmanlike manner in accordance with city paving specifications and is paid entirely by the person firm or corporation seeking such paving approval b prohibition against unauthorized paving of an alley and establishing criteria for a paving permit it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation to pave or cause to be paved a public alley in the city of south houston texas unless and until the paving has been approved by the city and the permit fee has been paid and it shall be unlawful for a person firm or corporation who has obtained a permit to pave an alley to allow the paved alleyway to fall into disrepair should the alley fall into disrepair and should the permit holder for the paving fail to promptly repair same upon written notice the city may perform the repairs and charge them and its attorneys fees for that action if any to the applicantpermit holder  and those charges shall be promptly paid to the city in reimbursement a condition precedent to the issuance of such a paving permit shall be the requirement that the applicant for the permit shall file or cause to be filed a drainage and paving plan from a registered professional engineer bearing hisher professional seal for the alley and its surrounding properties that assures the city that the normal sheet flow of surface drainage for the unpaved area shall not be adversely impacted in any way by this paving project the failure to file such a plan showing no such impact shall be grounds for denial of the permit the city may charge a reasonable administrative fee for this discretionary program another condition precedent for such an approval shall be the assumption of financial responsibility for all paving costs and inspection costs from the city so that the net effect of this approval shall be at no cost to the city for the project finally the application for the permit shall contain these conditions precedent shall be agreed to and accepted by the applicant and shall further state and applicant shall agree that in the event that the city must excavate the area paved in the future for a public purpose such as but not limited to the removal or replacement or repair of buried utility equipment lines cables or apparatus of any kind the city shall not be responsible for the repair of the excavated area and the applicant shall indemnify the city for and shall promptly pay for such costs such a commitment and assurance to the city for this permitted encroachment may be incorporated into a consent to encroachment agreement to be signed by the applicant and the city but even if no such separate agreement is executed the conditions and terms of the consent by the city for this paving shall be governed by this section with or without such a signed consent to encroachment agreement the person firm or corporation who paves the alley or who causes it to be paved or who parks on the paved alleyway shall never acquire any ownership or right to park or use the paved area in the alley this shall be a privilege and not a right and this privilege may be withheld or withdrawn if the applicant or user fails to meet all the ordinance requirements including but not limited to the continuing obligation to maintain the alleyway paved in a good state of repair the cessation of use by the applicantuser shall not terminate any continuing responsibility of the applicant for the in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accidental release means any unplanned uncontrolled or unconfined release of hydrocarbons or other chemicals from a pipeline or pipeline facility adjustment means the horizontal or vertical repositioning of a pipeline due to reasons unrelated to pipeline operations interstate gas pipeline means a pipeline used in the transportation of a natural gas flammable gas or a gas which is toxic or corrosive which is subject to the jurisdiction of the federal energy regulatory commission under the natural gas act except that it shall not include any pipeline within a state which transports gas from an interstate gas pipeline to a direct sales customer within such state purchasing gas for his own consumption interstate liquid pipeline means a pipeline used in the transportation of hazardous liquids in interstate or foreign commerce which are subject to the hazardous liquid pipeline safety act of 197 as amended intrastate pipeline means a pipeline which is not an interstate pipeline leak gas means any accidental release of hydrocarbons or other chemicals which are a gas or vapor in the pipeline leak liquid means any accidental release of more than five barrels fortytwo 42 gallons each of hydrocarbons or any other chemicals excluding water which are a liquid in the pipeline owner or operator means the individual partnership corporation or other entity that operates the pipeline as used in this article one term is always inclusive of the other unless otherwise specified pipeline means any pipe used in the transportation of gaseous or liquid hydrocarbons or any other chemicals except pipelines which transport gaseous or liquid hydrocarbons production facilities including flow lines gathering lines and gas lift lines and except pipelines located within property owned or leased by the pipeline owner and part of any oil refining or petrochemical plant pipeline station or terminal or other industrial manufacturing or processing facility repair means to restore or replace any broken leaking or defective part of a pipeline or replace any portion of the corrosion protection system replacement means any new pipeline or new section of a pipeline replacing any old pipeline or old section of pipeline being removed from service for any purpose other than to repair existing facilities replacement must occur in the same easement as the line being removed from service  61212 effect of other laws  zoning compliance the operation and maintenance of all pipelines within the city including without limitation existing pipelines shall conform in all respects to the standards rules and regulations established by the united states department of transportation or the state railroad commission whichever is more stringent b no new pipeline or existing pipeline shall be laid maintained or repaired in such a manner as been laid because of widening improving maintaining or repairing of such city road street roadbed ditch easement or rightofway or for reasons of public safety and welfare upon the requirement of the city engineer such pipeline shall be changed or altered promptly under the existing rightofway by the owner or operator of such pipeline in such a manner as to interfere no longer with such construction maintenance repair or the safety of the traveling public the owner or operator of such pipeline shall upon demand of the city council bear all of the cost and expense of such change or words and terms shall have the meanings ascribed below unless the context of their usage clearly indicates another meaning alteration means any modification replacement or reconstruction that increases the height or materially increases the dimension of a tower structure antenna means a tower as herein defined or a device or system of wires poles rods dishes discs or similar devices used for the transmission andor receipt of electromagnetic waves building official means the building inspector after consultation with and plan approval by the city engineer camouflage design or camouflage tower means the design of a tower or tower structure that blends into the surrounding environment and is visually unobtrusive examples of a camouflage design or tower are architecturally screened roofmounted antennaarrayequipment buildingmounted antennaarrayequipment that is painted and treated as an architectural element to blend with the existing building designs that conceal the antennaarrayequipment manmade trees clock towers bell towers steeples light poles and similar alternativedesign mounting structures department means a tower permit team consisting of the building inspector and the city engineer who shall be responsible for the enforcement of this article fcc means the federal communications commission grade means the lowest point of elevation of the finished surface of the ground paving or sidewalk within the area between the building or structure and a line five 5 feet from the building or structure height of the building means the vertical distance above a reference datum measured to the highest point of the coping of a flat roof or to the deck line of a mansard roof or to the average height of the highest gable of a pitched or hipped roof the reference datum shall be selected by either of the following whichever yields a greater height of the building 1 the elevation of the highest adjoining sidewalk or ground surface within a fivefoot horizontal distance of the exterior wall of the building when the sidewalk or ground surface is not more than ten 10 feet above the lowest grade 2 the elevation ten 10 feet higher than the lowest grade when the sidewalk or ground surface described in item a above is more than ten feet above lowest grade the height of a stepped or terraced building is the maximum height of any segment of the building height of the tower or antenna means the vertical distance between the finished grade at the base of the tower or the lowest point of contact with the building and the highest point of the tower structure excluding the antenna if any high mast light structure means a fixed freestanding uninhabitable structure of a minimum height of one hundred 100 feet specifically designed to carry light fixtures that is built on land on along or adjacent to streets roads highways and bridges maintained by the state or political subdivision of the state park means any property of the state or political subdivision thereof that is designated for and restricted to use by the pubic for park purposes public utility means any person company corporation cooperative corporation partnership or any combination thereof that is subject to both a municipal franchise agreement and the comprehensive regulatory system established by and defined in the texas public utility regulatory act that owns or operates for compensation equipment or facilities for 1 producing generating transmitting distributing selling or furnishing electricity  or 2 the conveyance transmission or reception of communications over a telephone system as a dominant carrier the term public utility shall not include as is defined in the public utility regulatory act telegraph services television stations radio stations community antenna television services general radiotelephone services or radiotelephone services authorized under the public mobile radio services rules of the federal communications commission or private water companies residence means any permanent building or structure containing habitable rooms for nontransient occupancy designed and used primarily for living sleeping cooking and eating which is intended to be used or occupied as a dwelling place for residential purposes whether or not attached including homes town homes patiohomes duplexes triplexes quadraplexes condominiums and apartments multiunit complexes shall be included at a ratio of oneeight acre of land or any fraction thereof as being equivalent to one residential tract for purposes of calculating the ratio of multiunit complex acreage to residential tracts only that portion of the multiunit complex acreage within the residential test area shall be considered hotels motels boarding houses group homes half way houses nursing homes hospitals nursery schools schools and child care facilities shall not be considered residences a building or structure located on a lot or tract of land used as the site of a tower shall not be considered a residence so long as its primary use is to contain house store and protect materials or equipment directly related to the purpose and use of the tower residential means pertaining to the use of land for a residence as is defined in this section or any property zoned as either r1a r1b r2 r3 r4 or r5c residential area means the area within five hundred 500 feet of a proposed tower site that contains fifty 50 percent or more tracts wholly or partially therein that are subject to residential restrictions or are in use for residential purposes or that are zoned r1a r1b r2 r3 r4 or r5c residential lot means 1 a lot which is included within a recorded residential subdivision subject to any enforceable valid and unexpired residential deed restrictions upon which a residence exists or may be constructed pursuant to those valid and applicable deed restrictions or 2 an unrestricted lot upon which a residence exits or 3 a lot zoned residential residential restrictions means one or more restrictive covenants limiting the use of the property to residential purposes that are contained or incorporated by reference in a property recorded map plat replat declaration deed judgment or other instrument filed in the county real property records map records or deed records setback area means the circular area surrounding a proposed tower structure and which delineates the area between the site of the proposed tower and the nearest residential structure or residential restricted tract of land as established in this article subdivision means all land encompassed within one or more maps or plats of land within the city that is divided into two 2 or more parts and are recorded in the deed map or real property records of the county or counties in which the land covered by the map or plat is located tower or tower structure means a fixed freestanding or guyed uninhabitable structure not designed as a shelter or to be occupied for any use this definition includes but is not limited to any such structure supporting antennae that transmit or receive any portion of the electromagnetic spectrum of radio waves the following are by way of example but not limitation towers or tower structures guyed or freestanding monopole structures lattice or open framed structures antennae supports water towers and other simple selfsupporting trussed or open framed structures tract means a contiguous parcel of property under common ownership  41100 tower permit required a an application for a tower permit shall be applicable setback area established by subsection e d a tower permit shall not be used for the construction or alteration of a tower structure in a park or on a tract surrounded by a park e a tower
